body.p: Le Philosophe Diderot dont la santé est encore chancellante, restera avec nous jusqu’au mois de févreïer qu’il retournera dans sa patrie. Grimm pense aussi de partir vers ce tems là. Je les vois très souvent et nos conversations ne finissent pas. Ils pourront Vous dire Monsieur le cas que je fait de Henry quatre et de l’auteur de la Henryade In Voltaire's epic portrayal of Henri IV, the French king stood for religious toleration and good kingship. The work naturally appealed to Catherine at a time when she was using religious freedom as a pretext for her ambitions in Poland. A reference to one of Voltaire's most prestigious literary successes was also a courteous and flattering touch on her part. et de tant d’autres écrits dont Vous avés illustré notre siècle. Je ne sais si ils s’ennuyent beaucoup a Petersbourg mais pour moi je leurs parlerai toute ma vie sans m’en lasser. Je trouve à Diderot une imagination intarrissable, et le range parmi les homes les plus extraordinaires qui ayent existé. S’il n’aime pas Moustapha come Vous me le mandé au moins suis je sûre qu’il ne lui veut point de mal, sa bonté de cœur ne le lui permettroit pas, malgré l’énergie de son esprit et le penchant que je lui vois de faire baisser la balance de mon côté. Hé bien Monsieur! il faut ce consoler de ce que le projet de Votre croisade a echoué en supposant que Vous avés eu à faire à des bones âmes aux quelles cependant il ne faudra pas accorder l’énergie de Diderot.

Come chef de l’Eglise grecque je ne puis Vous voir dans l’erreur sans Vous reprendre en bone fois. Vous auriés voulu voir la grande Duchesse rebatise dans l’Eglise de St: Sophie. Rebatisé dites Vous! Ah Monsieur! l’Eglise grecque ne rebatise point, elle regarde come authentique tout batême administré dans les autres Comunion Chrétienes. La grande Duchesse, après avoir prononcé en langue Russe sa profession Ortodoxe, a été reçuë dans le sein de l’Eglise grecque au moyen de quelque signe de croix d’huile Odoriférente qu’on lui a administré en grande Cérémonie, ce qui chés nous tout come chés Vous ce nome confirmation, àpropos de quoi on impose un nom. Sur ce point nous somes plus chiche que Vous qui en donné par douzaine, tandis qu’ici chaqu’un n’en a pas plus qu’il ne lui en faut, cet à dire, un seul.Prior to her marriage to Grand Duke Paul, Wilhelmine of Hesse-Darmstadt was received into the Orthodox Church as Natalya Alekseevna in August 1773. Born a Lutheran, Catherine had undergone a similar rite. Her self-description as head of the Orthodox Church (nominally true since Peter the Great's creation of the Holy Synod as the Tsar's administrative arm of the Church) and her explanation of the ritual might be read as examples of Voltairean irony. Vous ayant mise au fait de ce point important je continuë à répondre à Votre lettre du 19bre. Vous saurés àprésent Monsieur qu’un corps détaché de mon armé ayant passé le Danube au mois d’Octobre batit un Corps turk très considérablePeace negotiations with the Porte over free navigation of the Black Sea and the Crimea had stalled in the spring of 1773. Overriding Rumyantsev's disapproval, Catherine ordered him unsuccessfully to take the main army across the Danube even though its south bank was heavily covered with Turkish redoubts. By late summer Rumyantsev had withdrawn, forcing Catherine to patch up relations with a general whose good will she could not afford to lose. Nonetheless, in October 1773, Russian detachments again crossed the Danube, nearly took Varna, and bombarded Silistria; failing to engage the Turks in the field, the Russians had to return for the winter to the north bank of the Danube (Alexander, Autocratic Politics in a National Crisis, p. 14). Catherine must be alluding to these temporary successes. et fit prisonier un Bacha à trois queux qui le comandoit. Cet événement auroit pu avoir des suites, mais le fait est (chose dont Vous ne serés pas content peut être) qu’il n’i en eut pas, et que Moustapha et moi, nous nous trouvons à peu près dans la situation où nous étions il y a six mois, à cela près qu’il est attaque d’un Ahsme et que je n’en ai pas. Il ce peut que ce Sultan est un esprit supérieur, mais il n’en est pas moins battu pour cela depuis cinq ans, malgré les conseils de Mr de St: Priest et les instructions du Chevalier Thott qui ce tuera à fondre du Canons, à exercer des Canoniers, sera revêtu de Caffetans d’Hermines sans que pour cela l’Artellerie Turque en deviene meilleure et mieux desservie.On 1 November 1773, Voltaire wrote to Catherine: 'Il faut que Mr De st Priest ait bien raison, et que Moustapha ait un esprit bien supérieur, puisqu'il a sçu engager les meilleurs chrétiens du monde dans ses intérêts, et réunir à la fois en sa faveur les Français et les Allemands' (D18605). Tout cela sont des enfançes aux quelle l’on done beaucoup plus d’importance qu’elle ne mérite. Je ne sais où j’ai luë que ce tour d’esprit est naturel aux Welches.

closer.signed: Adieu Monsieur, porté Vous bien et soyés assuré que persone ne fait plus de cas de Votre amitié que moi.

body.p: The philosopher Diderot, still in shaky health, will remain with us until the month of February, when he will return to his homeland. Grimm too is thinking of leaving around that time. I see them very often, and our conversations are without end. They will be able to tell you, sir, how much I value Henry IV and the author of the Henryade and of so many other writings with which you have rendered our century illustrious. I do not know if they are very bored in Petersburg, but for myself I would speak with them for my whole life without growing weary of it. I find that Diderot has an inexhaustible imagination, and I rank him among the most extraordinary men who have ever existed. If he does not like Moustapha, as you informed me, at least I am certain that he wishes him no harm: the goodness of his heart would not permit him to do so, despite the energy of his wit and the inclination that I see in him to tip the scales in my favour. Indeed, sir! You shall have to console yourself for the failure of your projected crusade by supposing that you were dealing with good souls to whom Diderot's energy, however, cannot be ascribed.

As head of the Greek Church, I cannot see you err without calling you back in good faith. You would have liked to have seen the grand duchess rebaptised in the church of St. Sophia. Rebaptised, you say! Oh, sir! The Greek Church does not rebaptise: it regards as authentic any baptism administered in the other Christian communions. The grand duchess, after pronouncing in Russian her Orthodox creed, was received into the Greek Church by a mere sign of the cross with odoriferous oil. This was administered to her with great ceremony, which we, like you, call confirmation, at which point a name is given. In this matter we are stingier than you, who give them by the dozens, whereas here each person has no more than he needs, that is, just one. Now that you have been set straight on this important point, I will continue my reply to your letter of 1 Nov. You will know by now, sir, that a detachment of my army crossed the Danube in October, beat a very considerable Turkish corps, and took prisoner the three-tailed pasha who was commanding it. This event could have brought results, but the fact is (and this is something which will perhaps not please you) that it did not. And Moustapha and I find ourselves more or less in the situation we were in about six months ago, except that he has an asthma attack and I do not. It may be that this sultan is a superior wit, but he has none the less been beaten for the past five years for all that, despite the advice of Mr. de St. Priest and the instructions of the chevalier Thott, who will kill himself making cannon and drilling cannoneers and who will be dressed in ermine caftans without the Turkish artillery improving and being better served for all that. These are all childish follies to which people give much more weight than they are worth. I know not where I have read that this turn of mind comes naturally to the Welches.

closer.signed: Farewell, sir, be well and be assured that no one values your friendship more than I.
